newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka stocks close down, but turnover up.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka stocks close down, but turnover up.

text.p: Sri Lanka stocks closed lower on Thursday hampered by traditional pre-holiday dullness, but turnover was aided by trading in a few large share parcels, brokers said.
The Colombo Stock Exchange all share index closed 0.9 points down at 591.8 on a lack of widespread participation ahead of Christmas, brokers said.

"Holiday season inactivity dominated the market," said Subram Ramaswamy, deputy general manager of Bartleet Mallory Stockbrokers. "I predict the market will pick up after the holidays, but I don't see a huge increase either.
Turnover, supported by 150,000 shares of blue chip development bank DFCC at 270 rupees, 955,000 Kotagala Plantations at 26 rupees and over 800,000 Forbes Ceylon at 4.75, was 64.7 million rupees.
"Turnover was up mainly on these large parcels," said Sanjeeva Gunewardena of Commercial Stockbrokers. "Other than that there wasn't widespread activity."
Wednesday's turnover too was high at 149.4 million rupees.
"It shows that buyers and sellers have been meeting frequently, despite the index' downward movement," Gunewardena said. --Mohan Samarasinghe (941) 434319
